result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquann Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court will grant a petition for expungment if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations.

Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Complete an anger management program and a cognitive behavior therapy program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laquann Ferguson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. 
Credit for 6 days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" - STAYED.  To be used at the Probation Department's discretion.
* Perform 20 hours of community service.
* Seek and maintain full-time employment or school enrollment.
* Complete an anger management program.
* Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Laquann Ferguson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (missed office contact on 5-20-15), filed.

Defendant Laquann Ferguson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-18-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Laquann Ferguson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/28/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Martez B.; Herb G.; Chad W. or Daniel F. outside of their official capacities

Defendant Laquann Ferguson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Laquann Ferguson in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4) 

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
